description.p: You have been singled out as unwelcome in the group or society you were raised in, and have become isolated. Perhaps this was your own choice, your critical mind leading you to reject the rules of your society and leave as a conscientious objector, or you simply never fit in and chose to seek someplace you might belong better. Alternatively, you may have been forcibly ejected for your (mis)deeds or ideas, having done something inexcusable or speaking out contrary to those who rule. Regardless of how it occurred, you are no longer a part of your home culture, and have had to survive on your own.‚Äù

ul.li: Tool Proficiencies: Navigator's tools, one type of artisan's tools

Equipment: A memento from your former life (family crest, official order of rejection, a keepsake), a walking stick (quarterstaff), a compass, a winter blanket, a set of traveler's clothes, and a small pouch containing 5 gp.

description.p: There are many different kinds of exiles, implying different reasons for being cast out. You can roll on the following table to determine your exile type, or choose one that best fits your character.

Some exiles take time to adjust to their new life, clinging to the past, while others adapt quickly and try to sever any ties to home. They may be slow to trust or eager to make allies and find a new home. Some seek only to return.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I frequently talk to other travelers, seeking news about my former home.
I avoid the topic of my former home as much as possible.
I am slow to trust others and keep to myself.
I position myself with my back to a solid surface.
I'm extremely loyal to the friends I make.
Everything I say sounds sarcastic or cynical.
I still follow the culture and practices of my former home.
I feel a need to prove myself, to show I can help and should be kept around.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Revenge. No one who has done me wrong me will go unpunished. (Evil)
Belonging. Everyone has a place in the world, I just have to find mine. (Neutral)
Independence. Bad rules and traditions must be done away with. (Chaotic)
Tradition. However I feel about it, the law is the law and to break it is wrong. (Lawful)
Redemption. I will make the best of my circumstances to help others. (Good)
Destiny. Nothing will distract me from my higher calling. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: My family, clan, or heritage is the most important thing to me, despite the distance.
Someday I will return home to right past wrongs.
Those responsible for my situtation must pay!
People from my home desperately seek my return.
The past is behind me, I must work towards a better future for myself.
I am still being hunted, and will not be free until my pursuers are dealt with.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I am suspicious of others and expect the worst.
I have trouble holding my tongue, I must speak out.
I cannot let go of the past, and react poorly to reminders.
I am hiding something very important and dangerous (family secret, stolen treasure).
I have taken to substance abuse to cope with my situtation.
I am fearful of abandonment and hate to be alone.

description.p: You've learned to see society in a different way than most and can more critically evaluate it. As you spend time in a city, town, or tribe, the social dynamics of the system quickly become evident to you. By interacting with locals and spending time in the area you are able to determine things like the current balance of power, pressing issues and news, if there is unhappiness with the current status quo, and who important figures might be. However as an outsider, your criticism or interference are less welcome without good reason.
